text: Glass at Seiyo, 9/14/15.Creamy-beige with just a hint of haze and plentiful carbonation rising creating a cluster of bubbles that I wouldnt quite call a head.Not much in the nose, though some sugars, light almondmeal, rice crackers and sweet vanilla cream. No alcohol.Flavor is incredibly sweet. Yikes, was not expecting that. Its got some acidity on the end, and the carbonation helps mitigate the sweetness somewhat, but as soon as this thing starts warming and the carbonation dying down a touch (ie. unless you really chug the stuff), it really starts getting too sluggishly sweet. The flavors are enjoyable though, with some earthiness, warm, salted white rice porridge and hints of lemon and coconut.

Crisp sweet. Odd blue hue. Nose is a coconut party, light crispbread grainy. Lean creaminess then piled on sweetness, crisp carbonation and sticky mouthfeel. Finishes long pineapple and coconut water.Bottle, Japan Centre Online, Sake Monday tasting
Bottle at Craigs. Pours clear white wine with a thin white head. Aromas of pineapple, coconut. Taste is light sweet. Finishes sweet coconut.
Bottle. Near clear with white head. Aroma of apple, earth, sslightly fruity. Taste of pineapple and coconut, some apple. Quite sweet.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours a bit like water, pale and clear, nose is pear and pineapple, taste is pineapple juice with coconut, sweet.
Unclear pale white with bubbles, looks like a champagne. Taste is quite sweet, not too outspoken taste. Sparkling. (Haarlem 201304)

Bottle 30 cl. A cloudy gray-white colour with a small, fizzy, white head. An aroma of rice, caramel and citrus. The taste is heavy sweet. A medium body, oily texture, fizzy carbonation and a medium long finish.

Bottle. The nose is straight-ahead cheesecake, laced with peaches. Very light on the palate; sweet, fruity, bright, and lactic. Very clean on the finish; mouthfeel is a dichotomy of prickly and creamy. It may not be traditional, but I like it.

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2015 bottle at home .... light hazy clear ... soft coconut  ... sweet fruits ... hint of apple ... ... huge fizzy front ... nice sweet pineapple ... juicy plum.. quite full bodied ... i like this ... but it probably not a classic sake.3.7  bottle at home March 2015 .. light hazy yellow ... soft coconut husk ... soft pear juice nose ... sweet fruits ... pineapple and pear ... soft fruit ... nice.. massive pinnapple juice linger 3.6

Bottle.

Hazy white with a small head. Sweet aroma and taste of pear and citrus, also some vanilla. Quite interesting and different, at least for one who is not used to drink Sake.
Bottle. Sweet taste with notes of apple/pear and vanilla. The character reminds me somewhat of sparkiling wine, although more sweet than dry.

30 cL bottle. Pours cloudy yellow with a small white head, shortlived. Rice, peach, plum and slight wooden aroma. Sweet fruity, slight sugarish. Mixed rice and plum/peach fruity. Lingering sweet and fruity finish.

Bottle 300ml.ABV. 6.0%. Light unclear white - grey color with a small to average, fizzy, fair lacing, fully diminishing, white head. Aroma is moderate rice, floral, candy fruity - citrus. Flavor is light heavy sweet with a average to long duration, champagne brus ice. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20100908]
Hazy milky white with a smallw white head. Sweet aroma with fruity and milky notes. Sweet flavor with berries, lemon and lime. Finished sweet.

Bottle 30 cl. Courtesy of yespr. Pours a cloudy greyish white. The nose is sweet lemonish - pop-like. Medium body, quite fizzy, some rice notes yes, but mainly sweet and sodapoppish. A Sake made for the RTD segment?? 080910

Bottled. An unclear milky white sake with a thin rim of white head. The aroma has strong notes of rice as well as a bit of lemon. The flavor is sweet with notes of lemon, rice, plums, and cloying alcohol, leading to a dry alcoholic finish. Thanks yespr for sharing.
Bottle thanks to bman1113vr.  The look is clear, some white head.  The smell is banana, candy like, fruits, and rice.  The taste is fruits, sweet, very bubbly. Sweet foo foo drink.

(180ml bottle, courtesy of BMan1113VR)  Pours a cloudy white body with a small white head.  Aroma of vanilla, almond, banana, and florals.  Flavor of coconut, vanilla, mango, and almond with a nicely carbonated mouthfeel.

bottle thanks to bman1113vr.  poured a hazy white with a white head.  aroma of vanilla, banana, and just smelled plain sticky sweet.  flavor was vanilla and some other stuff i couldnt get.  body was medium with medium carbonation.

Bottle thanks to bman1113vr. Pours a cloudy white with white fizzy head, and excuse me for saying this, but "pretty". Aroma of tropical fruit, banana, taffy. Flavor is very much the same. Mouthfeel is medium body with low-medium fizzy carbonation. Overall, very nice!!!!
bottle thanks to bman1113vr, yellow off white color with lots of bubbles, aroma of paste, banana, cherry vanilla, cream soda, and coconut milk
Bottle. Body-Alka-Seltzer water. Nose-banana, plantain, banana Laff-e-atafee. Taste-sweet, banana syrup, nice CO2, tropical fruit, really cool and unique, fruity, nice refreshing taste. Very nice.
Crushed with carythedude and jakebra randomly at some place. Very sweet, almost sickeningly so. Not so interesting. I guess it was light for 8% though.
Crushed with Jakebra and Honkeybra by chance.  A sparkling sake?  Interesting.  Almost like drinking club soda with alcohol and sugar.

6% abv on  my bottle too.  MY bottle was $15.25 from Chicago.  Pours hazy at first via strong carbonation then settles down into a softly carbonated slightly hazy clear with a medium sized foamy head.  I think this is the first sake I have had that actually formed a head at all and lasted for any length of time.  It even has a decent lacing!  The aroma is mild with a soft polished rice note.  The mouth feel is crisp tingle and sweet.  Nice sweet polished rice crisp flavor.    Quite quaffable and unlike any sake I’ve ever had in my 20 different sakes.

Let me be the first to say that I was skeptical when I first saw this, but it is a winner in my book! By the way, the back if my bottle read 6% abv. Aroma is fruity and smells of somewhat cheap (poor quality) sake. Appearance is a hazy off-white, nearly lemonade. No head despite the carbonation. Taste is amazing. Milky, sweet, fruity, gorgeous sake. Body is light, mouthfeel is a creamy-syrupy mix and there is a bit of lively carbonation. Soo expensive ($11.99 for a 180ml bottle), but so yummy!
Creamy stuff!  Sparkling.  Tastes like a glass of Sprite.  Really delicious.  Its about 1/2 nigori, and 100% sweet.  Real easy drinkin!  Go buy this stuff - its a winner.

This was my first Sake. Shared it was shared with a fellow ratebeerian, and courtesy of a local liquor store owner. I really liked this alot. It went great with the sushi we had. Poured a cloudy light golden white color. Very sweet smell. Kind of bubbly like a champaigne. Very sweet. Hints of grapefruit and orange. I think it was retailing for about 9 bucks in California. Small bottle, but sure worth it!

180mL Bottle: Pours a milky pale white color, small white head and little lacing. Nose of light banana and koji, sweet fermenting rice notes. The flavor is zesty and citrusy with a orange/buckwheat and peppermint note along with a touch of alcohol. Very nice, creamy, right amount of carbonation and a bit of graininess and doughy in the background. Excellent, but 180mL of 8% aclohol junmai for $13? Sheesh.
